p: Of the patients with an objective response (BTH1677 n = 29; Control n = 10), the median DOR was 10.3 months in the BTH1677 arm (95% CI: 5.6, not estimable) vs 5.6 months (95% CI: 1.5, not estimable) in the Control arm (HR 0.92 [95% CI: 0.27, 4.20]; P = .9040; Table 2 and Fig. 4a). DOR by patient is illustrated in Fig. 4b. Of the patients with progressive disease or death (BTH1677 n = 17; Control n = 6), the PFS was 11.6 months in the BTH1677 arm and 9.6 months in the Control arm (HR 1.31 [95% CI: 0.54, 3.65]; P = .5639; Table 2).
